publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-535 Patrick Harvie: Planning Aid for Scotland and Community Involvement—That the Parliament notes the unique work undertaken by Planning Aid for Scotland in providing free independent advice, information, support and training to people looking to participate in the planning system; recognises its innovative community engagement programmes that aim to ensure that the planning system is made more inclusive and accessible to everyone; notes that the role of organisations such as Planning Aid for Scotland has become vital since the passing of the Planning etc. (Scotland) Act 2006 which requires greater community involvement in the planning process, and calls on the Scottish Government to recognise that the need for enhanced community involvement will require greater resourcing to ensure that this step change can be achieved. Supported by: Bill Wilson*, Robin Harper*
S3M-535 Planning Aid for Scotland and Community Involvement (lodged on 24 September 2007) Ken Macintosh*, Christine Grahame*, Alex Neil*, Des McNulty*, Johann Lamont*, Elaine Smith*, Hugh O’Donnell*
S3M-535 Planning Aid for Scotland and Community Involvement (lodged on 24 September 2007) Jackie Baillie*, David McLetchie*, Mike Pringle*
S3M-535 Planning Aid for Scotland and Community Involvement (lodged on 24 September 2007) Sarah Boyack*, Marlyn Glen*
